title: Pride of Britain Awards: Christine McGuinness puts on a glamorous display in a jewel encrusted gown
text:
She's a devoted mum to three young children.

And Christine McGuinness enjoyed a night away from parenting duties as she attended the Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House hotel on Monday evening.

The Real Housewives of Cheshire star, 31, oozed glamour in a peach jewel encrusted gown as she joined a host of other stars at the annual ceremony.

Flawless: Christine McGuinness enjoyed a night away from parenting duties as she attended the Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House hotel in on Monday evening

Christine looked happy and confident as she posed up a storm in the one-shouldered number which featured a plethora of glittering silver gems over a semi-sheer bodice.

The lower part of the floor length gown featured a semi-sheer mesh skirt with a split, allowing the star to showcase a hint of her toned pins.

Completing her look, Christine added a pair of silver heels, while she carried her essentials in a embellished white clutch.

Pulling out all the stops for the night, Christine's blonde locks were styled into tumbling curls, while her features were accentuated with glam make-up, including dramatic smokey eyes.

Showstopping: The Real Housewives of Cheshire star, 31, oozed glamour in a peach jewel encrusted gown as she joined a host of other stars at the annual ceremony

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Dazzling: Christine looked happy and confident as she posed up a storm in the one-shouldered number which featured a plethora of glittering silver gems over a semi-sheer bodice

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

Christine was without her TV star husband Paddy McGuinness, who last week revealed he had lost his wedding ring for the second time.

The mother-of-three took to Instagram on Monday to post a loved-up selfie with her spouse and told fans that he'd lost the ring during a family getaway two months ago and is yet to replace it.

All that glitters: Completing her look, Christine added a pair of silver heels, while she carried her essentials in a embellished white clutch

But Christine insisted that she's already forgiven Paddy, 46, for misplacing it, as she joked that he's wearing a T-shirt with her bikini-clad body.

In the post, Christine noted Paddy's hilarious blunder, and insisted that she's not too upset with the loss as he already has the ring tattooed on his finger.

The selfie showed Paddy - who she married in 2011 - wearing the T-shirt emblazoned with a bikini sketch that was the spitting image of his stunning wife.

She wrote: 'My wonderful husband @mcguinness.paddy lost his wedding ring.. again.. on our family holiday about 2 months ago!. He still hasn’t replaced it but today he is forgiven because he’s wearing a T shirt with my picture on!'
